snippet: Many technology executives, economists and policy makers say the use of software patents as destructive weapons has corrupted the marketplace for new ideas, Charles Duhigg and Steve Lohr report in the latest installment in The New York Times's...
abstract: Many technology executives, economists and policy makers say the use of software patents as destructive weapons has corrupted the marketplace for new ideas, Charles Duhigg and Steve Lohr report in the latest installment in The New York Times's "iEconomy" series.

headline.main: Daily Report: When Patents Become Weapons
